title: Katie McGlynn looks slightly worse for wear as after a night of partying at Inside Soap Awards
text:
She partied the night away with several of her TV pals at this year's Inside Soap Awards.

And Katie McGlynn was looking slightly worse for wear as she arrived back in Manchester on Tuesday after cutting loose in London at the awards the night before.

The Coronation Street star, 26, clutched a large white cloth in her hand as she carried a suitcase home.

Morning after: Katie McGlynn, 26, looked slightly worse for wear as she arrived back in Manchester on Tuesday after cutting loose at the Inside Soap Awards the night before

The actress cut a casual figure, donning a black printed t-shirt and skin-tight leather trousers with black boots.

Katie wrapped up with a dark grey faux fur coat while she styled her blonde locks into an updo.

The TV star appeared to try and shield her face with her dress as she made her way home following the night of fun.

At the awards show, Katie turned heads in a plunging white caped dress while the garment also featured cute pockets and a belt that clinched in her waist.

Fun: Katie partied the night away with several of her TV pals at this year's Inside Soap Awards

Katie swept her blonde tresses into an elegant up 'do, while she added an element of vampish glam with dark red lips and smokey eyes.

The star's appearance comes as her character Sinead is soon to lose her cancer fight, leaving behind husband Daniel and son Bertie.

Last month Katie marked the end of her time on the ITV soap on Instagram , writing a poignant message where she encouraged women to go to smear tests, alongside a picture of herself and her on-screen husband Daniel Osbourne (Rob Mallard).

Katie penned: 'After nearly 7 wonderful years playing Sinead Tinker, my time on the cobbles is coming to an end.

Style: The actress cut a casual figure, donning a black printed t-shirt and skin-tight leather trousers with black boots

Casual: Katie wrapped up with a dark grey faux fur coat while she styled her blonde locks into an updo

'I feel so privileged & honoured to have been a part of @coronationstreet I’ve honestly enjoyed every single second working alongside a BRILLIANT cast and crew who go above and beyond to make Corrie the amazing show that it is.

'I’m going to miss everyone so much. I’m sad to be leaving Sinead behind, but I felt the time was right for me to spread my wings & pursue other opportunities.

'As a team we felt Sinead’s ending on the show should highlight the importance of cervical cancer screenings - and that women NEED to go for their smear tests.

Low profile: The TV star appeared to try and shield her face with her dress as she made her way home following the night of fun

'Also, to highlight the issues women face when affected by cancer in or around pregnancy @mummys.star.

'Everyone has been working so hard on this storyline and I just hope I do Sinead, the show and the thousands of women out their who have been in Sinead’s position, justice.

'Sinead Tinker might be leaving Coronation Street, but I’ll carry a piece of her quirkinesses with me forever #Corrie #SineadTinker #CancerandPregnancy #CervicalCancer.'
description: The Coronation Street star, 26, clutched a large white cloth in her hand as she carried a suitcase home on Tuesday.
